item.title: The U.S. National Weather Service (NWS) forecasts dangerous
item.description: The U.S. National Weather Service (NWS) forecasts dangerous heat in some areas through Friday. If you spend more time outside because of work or activities, or if you live or work in a building with inefficient cooling, take steps to protect yourself & watch for signs of heat-related illness. #SummerReady

item.title: INCREASED FIRE THREAT: With conditions hot and very dry Wedn
item.description: INCREASED FIRE THREAT: With conditions hot and very dry Wednesday along with a light breeze, we have a very high fire threat in much of our region. We'll see an increase in rain by Thursday: https://www.wvnstv.com/weather/near-record-heat-continues-storm-chances-increase-soon/

item.title: The main story of today is the heat. Temperatures will be in
item.description: The main story of today is the heat. Temperatures will be in the mid to upper 90s areawide, and heat indices will peak near 100 degrees east of the Blue Ridge, and in the Roanoke Valley and other urban areas. Drink plenty of fluids, and take precautions to avoid or limit exposure to the heat during the afternoon. A few isolated showers are possible over the North Carolina mountains later today, and north of I-64, but otherwise dry for most of the area.
